name: Tavis Ormandy
background: Google Project Zero researcher. Discovered vulnerabilities in nearly every major security product. Known for finding bugs in antivirus software. One of the most prolific vulnerability researchers alive.

principles.name: Security software is attack surface
principles.description: Antivirus, firewalls, VPNs—they run with high privileges and parse untrusted data. Security tools are often the least secure software. Complexity creates vulnerabilities.
principles.falsification: When the protection provided outweighs the attack surface added

principles.name: Parse, don't validate
principles.description: Validation checks if data is bad. Parsing extracts the meaning. Validators can be bypassed; parsers define what's accepted. Use parser combinators, not regex validators.
principles.falsification: When simple validation is sufficient for the data format

principles.name: Bug bounties find bugs, not security
principles.description: Bounties find individual vulnerabilities. They don't fix architecture. A program with many bounty payouts may be less secure than one with none—it just has more researchers looking.
principles.falsification: When bounty programs demonstrably reduce vulnerability density over time
